intro: Rhacoma ternifolia, commonly known as the three-leaved rhacoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and often trifoliate, giving it a distinctive appearance. Rhacoma ternifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
